channel.title: Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion
channel.description: This game is legendary, it is so rammed full of stuff to do that you can practically play for hours on end and discover new things all the time. I have it on PS3 and i am eagerly looking foward to the release of the Shivering aisles expansion pack that is to be released for my console. The bits and bobs in the game are phenominal i would like to know what everyone else thinks and i will be happy to post some quest guides for you should you want them(and that it's not against the mopar rules.) My favourite quest is the last quest in the main story. I shall not ruin the surprise but there are some big changes in the game afterwards

item.title: Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

[quote=“exe626, post:34, topic:115501”][quote author=llib link=topic=164773.msg1783731#msg1783731 date=1190884356]
PC ftw. Easiest to get mods for the PC version
[/quote]No. PC version is like, gay. I can get like 80fps on average on PC version, and it doesn’t even look half as better. 4bg game for your PC or play on 360? 360 > PC.[/quote]

Reason I said PC is better is because of the plugins. Guess you missed that part. Sure you can download some off xbox live I suppose, but the really cool ones like…

This really cool Hashshashin armor set based off Assassin’s Creed

Or this aurora night sky texture

Or this storage room acessable from any of the POHs for storing weapons, armor etc. (one of 3 rooms)

(the list goes on and on, those are some of my favorites)

Can only be obtained on PC my friend.

Honestly, I would gladly sacrifice some eyecandy for a LOT more content for the game. Not to mention for PC you can download TES Construction Set from Bethesda’s website and then you can build your own dungeons, POH’s, custom quests, custom races, etc. That beats everything else 360 has to offer in my opinion…

Then if you think about it, all the texture replacement mods I’ve downloaded I’m guessing even with my lower graphics, certain areas of the game look a lot nicer then the xbox360/ps3 versions…but thats just my opinion.

*Last note 4gb didn’t make a very big dent on my 141gb hard-drive.

PC ftw!

Read full topic

item.title: Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:31, topic:115501”]u wouldnt wanna play on 360 PS3 version better[/quote]360 version is better than PS3, honestly. I’ve played both, it truly is.

[quote=“llib, post:33, topic:115501”]PC ftw. Easiest to get mods for the PC version :D[/quote]No. PC version is like, gay. I can get like 80fps on average on PC version, and it doesn’t even look half as better. 4bg game for your PC or play on 360? 360 > PC.

[quote=“llib, post:33, topic:115501”]Forget about a “good weapon and armor” just go around beating monsters to a pulp with the dull sword or whatever you have now. As you level up you’ll find better weapons/armor.[/quote]Good weapons and armor are the key ingredient in leveling up. If you really want to get good-armor/weapon, go into Tombs or revisit old quest rooms(like caves and such), after a day or week in the game, everything in it is restocked. If your having problems getting through dungeons and tombs, Start>Game Play>Difficulty. Adjust to appropriate settings to give you an edge in the game.

Read full topic

item.title: Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion
item.dc:creator: @llib llib
item.description:
@llib wrote:

Smezy:

I need to find out how i can get a good Weapon and armour, i just started and i’m to much of a Sissy to even find martin cause i’m in need of Stuff.

Forget about a “good weapon and armor” just go around beating monsters to a pulp with the dull sword or whatever you have now. As you level up you’ll find better weapons/armor.

sanga282:

u wouldnt wanna play on 360 PS3 version better

PC ftw. Easiest to get mods for the PC version

item.title: Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Speljohan:

Oblivion is pretty good, but Morrowind is TONS better.

/EPIC FAIL

Oblivion is by far the best Elder Scrolls game thus far. I beat it ages ago, but I play it from time to time to try to find things I didn’t do, was a great experience going through the vast landscape find new areas to find new armors and items, was definitely worth buying
